Class MasterThread

java.lang.Object
MasterThread
public class MasterThread extends Object
The MasterThread class is responsible for the execution of slave threads to solve quadratic equations. It manages the buffer, slave threads, and provides statistics about the computation of individual threads.

  • Constructor Details

    • MasterThread

      public MasterThread(Buffer buffer, int numThreads, int numCoefficients, boolean is30Equations)
      Constructor for MasterThread that initializes the following parameters.
      Parameters:
      buffer - The buffer for quadratic equations and their roots.
      numThreads - The number of slave threads to be used to solve the quadratic equations.
      numCoefficients - The total number of sets of coefficients to solve with.
      is30Equations - A flag indicating whether to print additional information specifically for if 30 equations are to be processed.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start() throws InterruptedException
      Starts the MasterThread. This method creates an executor service with a fixed number of threads. It generates random coefficients for quadratic equations and adds them to the equation buffer. Launches slave threads to solve the quadratic equations concurrently. It waits for all slave threads to finish their processing using a CountDownLatch and measures the total time taken to solve all equations. It then shuts down the executor service, allowing time for threads to complete their tasks. Prints the total number of equations solved and, if 30 equations were solved, the roots for each equation. If 3000 equations it prints statistics for each thread.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - Throws if the thread is interrupted while waiting for slave threads to finish.

    • getMasterThread

      public static MasterThread getMasterThread(int choice)
      Method to create a MasterThread instance based on the specified choice of number of equations.
      Parameters:
      choice - The choice indicating the number of coefficients (30 or 3000).
      Returns:
      A MasterThread instance with the specified parameters.
